summary: The Access to Reproductive Care for Servicemembers Act (HR 1742) aims to ensure that members of the Armed Forces have access to reproductive healthcare, including abortion and assisted reproductive technology, regardless of their location or state laws. The bill mandates leave for non-covered reproductive care, prohibits adverse actions against service members seeking care, and provides reimbursement for travel costs. This bill seeks to protect the reproductive rights and well-being of military personnel and their dependents.
